items.content_html: This is insane. Thousands of people giving out their password reset security question responses for “first car”. I can’t believe how bad this is.
Daring Fireball: Brian Krebs on ‘Security Questions’ and Facebook Surveys
First attempt. That was fun. #e1
Son’s report card has one special that says, “continues to make progress on making good choices.” Wow. That’s impressive language. I will start using that on others.
Great ending.
Need a few cocktails. That was so tense!That was for a 3 week!!! civil trial. Sent home. Not gonna happen for me. So happy. Signing off! #juryduty
Oh joy. That’s it. Out of time. Everybody go home. I’m done. I can’t believe how happy I am! #juryduty #overanddone
Descending into other jurors talking about how they would run this process if they were in charge. To solve is human? Or just idol banter? #juryduty #waiting
Listening to other jurors waiting around talk about waiting around is worse than waiting around. #juryduty
Contemplating unplugging the TV. Make things happen. Solve the problem. #juryduty #waiting
The hallway guards get mightly cranky when you walk the hallway eating peanut M&Ms out of your coat pocket. #juryduty #boredoutofmymind #waiting
Reading Zeynep Tufekci in Wired: “The most effective forms of censorship today involve meddling with trust and attention, not muzzling speech itself.” Yep! #juryduty #waitingroom
Maybe I should start up a side rant about daytime TV and the inane crap being broadcast and watched by the zombie hive? #juryduty #goinginsane #waitinggame
Back from lunch in waiting room. TV going strong. I hate it so much. Hiding in side area. #juryduty
Ramen!
And it’s lunch time. But I can’t go home. Still need to come back after lunch with an anticipated interview. Oh boy! #juryduty
Number of people in the room getting smaller as people are dismissed. Bad for me I guess. #juryduty
Going through jury interviews. Everyone in the room got one of two trials but it’s a lot of people. Video said CT has right to interview jurors in the constitution. Interesting. #juryduty
Some guy dictating text messages into his phone. The best of us. “Everyone of you is qualified as anyone else in this room to serve.” - intro video. #juryduty
9:30. Break until 10:00. Wish there was WiFi. Back to the quiet corner. Why must the tv be on all the time. #juryduty

Jury video. You can tell the creation date by the version of iOS messages on the phone showing “don’t text or blog about the case”. Defendant actor in the video was millenial hipster with beard. Hmm. #juryduty
Folks on their mobile on conference calls. Are they really that critically important?! #juriduty
They made us all go into the room with the TV. Some country “musician” performing on GMA. Oh the agony. Why are they punishing us? Turn it off. #juryduty
They worst thing in this room is two jurors who are friends. Giggling and chatting. Sickening compared to the rest of us standoffish folks. #juryduty
15 minutes ago she said we have about 15 minutes to wait. She just said now we have 15-20 minutes to wait. Another WiFi question. “At least we have parking!” #juryduty
